Message.Title: Alias Define Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The signal in argument FromSignal: , must be defined in the IO configuration and the signal in argument ToSignal: , must be declared in the RAPID program and not defined in the IO configuration.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check the IO configuration and the RAPID program.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Orientation definition error in .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
This is probably an off-line generated "dummy" position (undefined orienta-
tion), which needs to be modified with modpos.

Message.Title: Alias IO Installation
Message.Description: The system could not refresh all IO signals as RAPID symbols.
Message.Consequences: No IO signals can be used in a RAPID program.
Message.Causes:
- Incorrect IO configuration
- Incorrect task configuration
Message.Actions: Restart the controller.

Message.Title: IO Installation
Message.Description:
Task :
The system could not refresh all IO signals as RAPID symbols.
Message.Consequences: No IO signals can be used in a RAPID program.
Message.Causes:
- Incorrect IO configuration
- Incorrect task configuration
Message.Actions: Restart the controller.

Message.Title: Mechanical Units
Message.Description: The system could not refresh all mechanical units as RAPID symbols.
Message.Consequences: No mechanical units can be used in a RAPID program.
Message.Causes:
- Incorrect Motion configuration
- Incorrect task configuration
Message.Actions: Restart the controller.

Message.Title: Camera Installation
Message.Description:
Task :
The system could not refresh all camera units as RAPID symbols.
Message.Consequences: No camera units can be used in a RAPID program.
Message.Causes:
- Incorrect camera configuration
- Incorrect task configuration
Message.Actions: Restart the controller.

Message.Title: Save or Erase Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The program module could not be saved or could not be erased.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the spelling of the module name
- Check if the module is loaded.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Reference Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The reference to the load session is not valid.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check if the specified reference is the same as in StartLoad
Recovery:

Message.Title: Save Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Missing file source .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Use FilePath argument to specify the file destination.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Frame Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unable to calculate new frame.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: The positions have not the required relations or are not specified with enough accuracy.
Message.Actions:
Check if the positions are too close or not specified with enough accuracy.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The value of the argument for signal is above its maximum logical value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Change the argument or change the maximum logical value parameter
for the signal.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The value of the argument for signal is below its minimum logical value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Change the argument or change the min logical value parameter for the signal.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The value of the argument for signal is below the value for argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change the values of the arguments.

Message.Title: Symbol Definition Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The string in text table at index is too long.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change the file for the text table and perform a cold start.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description: The axis is not defined.
Message.Actions: The axis has to be defined, before this instruction is executed.

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit Error
Message.Description:
Task:
It is not possible to define a payload on the robot with this instruction.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Use the instruction GripLoad instead of MechUnitLoad.

Message.Title: Symbol Definition Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The requested text or text package does not exist. Text table , Index .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check the arguments.
Recovery:

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Unable to access the I/O signal on unit .
Impossible to restart.
Message.Causes: The connection with the I/O module is broken.
Message.Actions:
Re-establish the connection with the I/O unit. To make it possible
to restart the program move PP to a safe restart position.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
None of the option arguments DO1, GO1, GO2, GO3 or GO4 are specified.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Specify at least one of the arguments.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
The PERS variable specified in the instruction TriggStopProc cannot be
updated, because it does not exist any more.
Message.Causes:
The program module with the PERS variable is probably removed from the
program memory.
Message.Actions: Check if the module with the PERS variable is removed, if so put it back.

Message.Title: Context Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Instruction may only be used in an event routine.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Remove the instruction.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The timing parameter DipLag is larger than the system parameter Event preset time.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Increase the system parameter Event preset time or check the equipment dip lag (delay) compensation.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Not a valid subtype in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the argument.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Invalid value in in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the argument.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
is less than in argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the argument.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
TRUE in parameter in combination with conveyor coordination.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Cannot use fine points when leaving conveyors after coordinated stoppoint.
Use a zone instead.

Message.Title: Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Cannot read or write to the system parameter . The parameter is internal and protected from reading and writing.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The data to write from parameter CfgData to the system parameter, is outside valid limits.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
It is not possible to execute StartMove when the robot is moving.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Some load session with StartLoad - WaitLoad has not been finished.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Finish the load session with WaitLoad, cancel it with CancelLoad or set PP to main.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Memory Fault
Message.Description:
Task:
Because of power fail in executed Load or StartLoad ... WaitLoad instruction, the RAPID program memory is inconsistent.
*** TO REPAIR DO P-START ***
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Important to do P-start, because the RAPID program memory is destroyed:
- Faulty init value of PERS variables
- Reduction of the available program memory size

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
There are no arguments given.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: If you want a limitation set the optional argument On with a value, otherwise set to Off.

Message.Title: Context Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Instruction may only be used in a trap routine.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Remove the instruction.

Message.Title: Context Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Instruction may only be used in a trap routine ordered through instruction .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check that INTNO has the interrupt number used by .

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The load session you are trying to cancel is not in use.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description: Unable to access the I/O signal unit .
Message.Causes: The connection with the I/O module is broken.
Message.Actions: Re-establish the connection with the I/O unit.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument Data in has improper data type.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the data type.Non-value and semi-value types may not be used.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument has a negative value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Set the value positive or to zero.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The value of argument forces the robot out of workspace.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Decrease the value.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The instruction cannot be executed while the system is in a stop state.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Switch Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The instruction must be used with one switch argument.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Use one of the switch Total or Free.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
In the instruction the argument is not an open directory.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Open the directory before trying to read it.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
In the instruction the argument can't be used without the argument .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Search Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Object of the type could not be searched for.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Symbol Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
No system symbol is accessible in the system.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Symbol Read Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The symbol is not a readable object.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Symbol Type Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The symbol is of type and not the expected type .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the RAPID program.

Message.Title: Symbol Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The symbol is not accessible in this scope.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: I\O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The instruction has lost contact with the conveyor.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Instruction Interrupted
Message.Description:
Task:
The instruction was interrupted, reason unknown.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Object Dropped
Message.Description:
Task:
The object that the instruction was waiting for has been dropped.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: Start window passed or Checkpoint not satisfied.
Message.Actions:
If Checkpoint not used, Checkpoint Distance and Checkpoint Window Width must be set to zero.
Rerun the instruction
Recovery:

Message.Title: Conveyor Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Another instruction is waiting for a distance to the object.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Conveyor Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Another instruction is waiting for the object.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Conveyor Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The instruction is already connected.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Booking of the new error number failed. The init value must be -1 or the old number.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the init value of the new errnum variable.

Message.Title: Error Number Local
Message.Description:
Task:
The RAPID user error number must not be declared as local in routine.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the errnum declaration.

Message.Title: Data Object Error
Message.Description:
Task:
There is no valid data object for the argument of the instruction .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check if there is a right data object.

Message.Title: File Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The parameter does not correspond to any loaded text file.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check if the text file is (correct) installed.

Message.Title: Mode Error
Message.Description:
Task:
File or serial channel is not opened for writing.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check how the file or serial channel was opened..

Message.Title: Mode Error
Message.Description:
Task:
File or serial channel is not opened in a character-based mode.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check how the file or serial channel was opened.

Message.Title: Mode Error
Message.Description:
Task:
File or serial channel is not opened in a binary mode.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check how the file or serial channel was opened.

Message.Title: Mode Error
Message.Description:
Task:
File or serial channel is not opened for reading.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check how the file or serial channel was opened.

Message.Title: Read Error
Message.Description:
Task:
One or more bytes is not read properly. The value of the read data might be
inconsistent.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: Because the checksum for the received message is not the same as calculated at sending, the message data cannot be used.
Message.Causes:
The reason can be:
- Communication problem
- Different WriteAnyBin - ReadAnyBin software version between the sending WriteAnyBin and the receiving ReadAnyBin
Message.Actions: Error Recovery for communication problem:

Message.Title: User Frame Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to get the coordinated user frame.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Axis Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The single axis is not init correctly.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Limitation Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The string length of the argument for the file path is too long.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: The maximum allowed string length for the full system file path is characters.
Message.Actions: Shorten the length of the path.

Message.Title: Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The RAPID string is too long.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: String value exceeds the maximum allowed length.
Message.Actions:
Rewrite the program to use strings of less length.
Recovery:

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
No space left on device (file name ).
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
File open/access error for path .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check permission, is the file write protected?
- Check if the file or directory exists.
- Check if there is any space left on device.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Error Installing Text Table
Message.Description:
Task:
No or faulty text resource name or index number in the text file.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: The contents of some of the text tables may have been destroyed.
Message.Actions: Correct the error, cold start the system and try again.

Message.Title: Error Installing Text Table
Message.Description:
Task:
The specified index within the text resource already exists in the system.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes:
- Error in the index numbering.
- The file has been installed twice.
Message.Actions: If error in the index, correct it, cold start the system and try again.

Message.Title: Error Installing Text Table
Message.Description:
Task:
System memory for text tables is full.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Reduce the amount of user defined text string installed from RAPID. Cold start the system and try again.

Message.Title: Overload Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The system is overloaded so the actual order cannot be ready in time.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Reduce the main computer load, for example by:
- Add WaitTime in RAPID loops
- Increase filter time for I/O signals
- Avoid cyclic interrupts

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description: Unable to access the I/O signal on unit .
Message.Causes: The connection with the I/O module is broken.
Message.Actions: Re-establish the connection with the I/O unit.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
TestSignRead is using a channel without a defined signal.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Use TestSignDefine to define a signal to the channel.

Message.Title: Tool Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The component robhold in the tool has not got the correct value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Change the value of robhold.
If the robot is holding the tool the value should be TRUE. If the robot is not holding the tool, i.e. a stationary tool, the value should be FALSE.

Message.Title: Calculation error
Message.Description:
Task:
Cannot calculate the tool frame.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: It is not possible to calculate the tool frame with the selected approach points.
Message.Actions: Select new approach points as accurate as possible.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to do subscribe.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: There is no memory left to make another subscription on this variable.
Message.Actions: To continue, PP must be moved to main!

Message.Title: Error msg too long
Message.Description:
The length of the following error message was too long and has been cut.
This means you will not be able to read the whole message.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument "type" in stoppointdata may not be followtime in the instructions MoveJ, MoveAbsJ and MoveExtJ.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change "type" to inpos or stoptime.

Message.Title: Motion Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Error from MocGenInstr.
Ref to former message for reason.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: IOF Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Error from IofGenInstr.
Ref to former message for reason.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: File Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The file already exists.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
To be able to rename or copy:
Change the file name or remove the existing file.
Recovery:

Message.Title: No Contact With Unit
Message.Description:
Task:
There is no contact with unit.
Program Ref:
Message.Causes:
- The unit may have been disabled ( IODisable "UNIT1", 1; )
- No power to the unit.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Not allowed to run this program in non_motion_execution_mode.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change mode.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The task is not allowed to execute the instruction .
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: The task is not configured to control mechanical units.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration or remove the instruction.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
StartMove could not get the regain distance.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Please restart the path.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Non Existing Axis Number
Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown axis number for the mechanical unit
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the value for the argument Axis.

Message.Title: RolGenInstr Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Error from instruction RolGenInstr.
Ref. to former user or internal error message for reason.
Program Ref.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Item source exists
Message.Description: Item source already exists. Two item sources may not have the same name.

Message.Title: Not a valid name
Message.Description: Choose or

Message.Title: Buffer size exceeded
Message.Description: Fatal internal error for item source . Try warm start or cold start. Please report this error.

Message.Title: Item source not defined
Message.Description: The item source object has not been defined.

Message.Title: Itmsrc internal error
Message.Description:
Internal error for item source .
Error type: .

Message.Title: Flush item source first
Message.Description: Item source must be flushed before it is used.

Message.Title: Ack item target first
Message.Description:
Item target must be acknowledged before executing the GetItmTgt(s) instruction again.
Error occurred for item source .

Message.Title: Item target buffer full
Message.Description: Item target buffer full for item source .

Message.Title: Conveyor I/O init error
Message.Description:
Error in the initialization of the I/O signal for item source , for conveyor
. I/O signal name .

Message.Title: Conveyor does not exist
Message.Description: Error for item source . The conveyor does not exist.

Message.Title: No conveyor name given
Message.Description: Error for item source . No conveyor name specified.
